Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

‘Marj-Mini’ possesses a uniquely sweet, warm, and slightly spicy flavour with pronounced floral notes of camphor and balsam, and a distinct absence of oregano’s characteristic bitterness. Its leaves are small, soft, oval, and a vibrant grey-green, growing on a dense, bushy plant that is exceptionally productive for its size.

2. The Fragrant Finisher

This herb is best used at the end of cooking or raw to preserve its delicate, volatile oils.

  • The Secret to Sausages: A classic, essential herb in many European sausage recipes, where its sweetness complements the rich, fatty meat without overpowering it.
  • Vegetables & Cream Sauces: A transformative addition to sautéed mushrooms, roasted root vegetables, creamy pasta sauces, and vinaigrettes, adding a layer of sophisticated fragrance.
  • Herbal Butters & Oils: Perfect for blending into compound butters for fish or steaks, or for steeping in olive oil to create a beautifully aromatic finishing oil for bread and salads.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The plant forms a tender perennial, bushy mound. Regular harvesting of the tip shoots encourages a denser, more productive form. Supplied as an RFID seed pad, it provides a surprisingly generous and continuous yield of 15–30g of tender, fragrant leaves per week.
